intro: Hypopitys hypophegea, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the high elevations of the Appalachian Mountains. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bright red berries that persist through winter. The plant has a unique reproductive strategy, relying on specific bird species for seed dispersal. Its limited geographic range and habitat specificity make it highly vulnerable to environmental changes. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this ecologically significant species.
